title: AUDITIONS
text:
Published: Thu, October 8, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
AUDITIONS 
ACTORS 
Old Fashioned Musical Christmas Show, Area Community Theatre of Sharpsville, Pierce Opera House, 100 N. Mercer Ave., Sharpsville, Pa., auditions 4 to 6 p.m. Oct. 18 and 7 to 9 p.m. Oct. 20. Interested performers should bring a Christmas song of their choice for the accompanist and be prepared to sing 32 bars. Participants also may be asked to do a brief reading from the script. Performances will be Dec. 19 and 20. For information, call 724-699-8249. 
Ken Ludwig’s “Leading Ladies,SDRq directed by Sam Luptak Jr., Salem Community Theatre, 490 E. State St., 7 p.m. Oct. 18 and 19. Needed are five male and three female actors of various ages. All roles are open, and those auditioning should come prepared to read from the script and interact with others. A sense of physical comedy is desirable. Callbacks, if necessary, will be scheduled after auditions. Rehearsals will begin Jan. 10, 2016, and there will be six performances over two weekends, from Feb. 26 to March 6. For information, contact the theatre at 330-332-9688, or email salemtheatre@att.net . 
Tom Dudzick’s “Greetings!,SDRq directed by Eric S. Kildow, Kent Trumbull Theatre, 4314 Mahoning Ave., Warren, auditions 5 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 19 and 20. Actors will be provided cold readings from the script. Auditions are open to the public. The work follows Andy, who has a sweet Catholic mother, a sour Catholic father and an intellectually disabled younger brother named Mickey. When he brings his Jewish, atheist fiance to meet the folks on Christmas Eve, his worst fears about family blow-ups are realized. But when Mickey suddenly spouts the word “Greetings!,” the entire family’s belief system is turned upside down. Characters are: Andy Gorski, 33-year-old male; Randi Stein, 29-year-old female, Andy’s Jewish fiancee; Phil Gorski, mid-60s male, Andy’s father; Emily Gorski, mid-60s female, Andy’s mother; and Mickey Gorski, 30-year-old male, Andy’s brother, intellectually disabled but inhabited by a wise ancient spirit. Performances are 8 p.m. Dec. 4, 5, 11 and 12, and 3 p.m. Dec. 6 and 13. For information, contact Kildow at ekildow@kent.edu . 
ENTERTAINERS 
Talent Show, at Fat Guy’s Bar and Grille, 1722 S. Raccoon Road, Austintown. A talent show will be Oct. 22 at the bar, and singers, dancers, bands, comedians and more are needed. To sign up, call 330-720-2485 or 330-792-5585. Other stories of interest
